title: Product of Sine and Cosine
text: The formula for the product of sine and cosine is sin(a)cos(b)=1/2[sin(a+b)+sin(a-b)].

title: Substituting Angles
text: Substitute the given values for the angles into the formula and simplify to rewrite the product as an equivalent sum.

title: Identifying Angle a
text: From the left hand side of the formula as sin(a)cos(b), what is the angle measure of a?

title: Identifying Angle $$b$$
text: From the left hand side of the formula as sin(a)cos(b), what is the angle measure of $$b$$?

title: Plugging into Formula
text: To rewrite the product of a sine and cosine into a single sum with only sine, plug in the angle values identified for a and $$b$$ into the right hand side of the formula.
